intro: Crotalaria guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan cowpea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces distinctive yellow flowers with prominent violet veins, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Crotalaria guatemalensis is also noted for its toxic properties, containing pyrrolizidine alkaloids that can be harmful to livestock.
